The existence of hepatitis C – originally identifiable only as a type of non-A non-B hepatitis – was suggested in the 1970s and proven in 1989.  Hepatitis C infects only humans and chimpanzees. Acute symptoms develop in some 20% of those infected.  When this occurs, it is generally 4–12 weeks following infection . Symptoms are generally mild and vague, and may include fatigue, nausea and vomiting, fever, muscle or joint pains, abdominal pain, decreased appetite and weight loss, jaundice , dark urine, and clay-coloured stools Hepatitis C Hepatitis C

knowledge: Appendicitis Appendicitis Appendicitis is inflammation of the appendix.  The most common signs and symptoms of appendicitis in adults and older children are abdominal pain that starts near the belly button and moves to the lower right side of the abdomen, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, abdominal swelling, and a low-grade fever.  The exact cause of appendicitis is unknown, but it can occur when the appendix becomes blocked, resulting in infection and inflammation. Appendicitis is a relatively common condition that requires prompt medical attention and often surgical removal of the appendix.
response: Yes, appendicitis is a relatively common condition that requires prompt medical attention and often surgical removal of the appendix.

dialog: Hi Medi, I just had a dental procedure done. Any advice for post-procedure care?
Of course, I'm here to help. What type of dental procedure did you have?
I had a tooth extraction.
After a tooth extraction, it's important to avoid drinking through a straw and eating hard or chewy foods. Make sure to gently rinse your mouth with warm saltwater to keep the extraction site clean.
How long should I expect the healing process to take?
The healing process varies for each individual, but it usually takes about 1-2 weeks. Make sure to follow your dentist's instructions and attend any follow-up appointments.
Should I take any pain medication?
If you experience pain or discomfort, you can take over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen. However, always consult with your dentist or healthcare provider for specific recommendations.
Are there any warning signs I should watch out for during the healing process?
